title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4036.1 - Time, manner of weighing in
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4036.1 - Time, manner of weighing in

State Regulations

Every jockey must immediately after pulling up ride his
or her horse to the place of weighing, dismount only after obtaining permission
from the official in charge and present himself or herself to be weighed by the
clerk of the scales; provided that if a jockey is prevented from riding to the
place of weighing by reason of accident or illness by which he or she or his or
her horse is disabled, such jockey may walk or be carried to the
scales. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

4036.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
